channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: China admits six hospital staff have died and over 1,700 health workers have caught coronavirus
US can't assess coronavirus data coming out of China, health secretary says
Justice Department drops McCabe criminal investigation
item.description: The Department of Justice is dropping its criminal investigation involving former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe without bringing charges, it announced on Friday.

item.title: Trump and Bloomberg: A septuagenarian spat fit for Twitter
item.description: One septuagenarian New Yorker is a "5'4" mass of dead energy." The other septuagenarian New Yorker is a "carnival barking clown." Both are hoping to be president next year.

item.title: Barr privately ordered re-examination of Michael Flynn's case, US officials say
Don Lemon throws shade on Barr's rebuke of Trump
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon says that Attorney General Bill Barr's actions in regard to handling cases involving President Donald Trump's enemies does not match Barr's rhetoric about being independent from Trump.

item.title: Fighting closes in on displaced families in northwest Syria
item.description: A Syrian mother tells CNN's Arwa Damon that her displaced family is trapped with nowhere safe to go as nearby fighting between rebels and Syrian government forces creeps closer, and winter's cold takes it toll.

item.title: Man who spent 14 years in prison exonerated with the help of genetic genealogy
item.description: A California man who spent 14 years in prison for the murder of a newspaper columnist has been exonerated thanks to the same DNA technology that caught the Golden State Killer suspect, authorities said.

item.title: NYT: US attorney leading Russia probe investigating whether US intelligence agencies hid information
item.description: The federal prosecutor leading the probe into the 2016 Trump-Russia investigation might be pursuing a basis to accuse former US intelligence officials who served under former President Barack Obama of hiding intelligence about Russia's election interference, according to The New York Times.

item.title: Europe's stagnant economy is vulnerable to a shock from China
Trump makes 86 false claims over two weeks
item.description: President Donald Trump made 31 false claims last week and 55 the week before, including 22 at a campaign rally in Des Moines, Iowa, in late January and 13 in an official speech at a community college in Charlotte, North Carolina, in early February.

item.title: He was given Medal of Freedom. Now, he's targeting Buttigieg for his sexuality
item.description: Conservative radio personality and Medal of Freedom recipient Rush Limbaugh said 2020 presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg had little chance of winning the election because "America's still not ready to elect a gay guy."

item.title: Skiing vacations could soon be a thing of the past
item.description: The organizers of last month's cross-country skiing world cup in Nove Mesto na Morave had just enough snow to cover roughly 4 kilometers (2.5 miles) of ski tracks.

item.title: Student redraws a map of the US to drive us all mad
item.description: Some people just want to watch the world burn. But only a mad few decide to light the blaze themselves.

item.title: Body of British hiker missing in New Zealand found
item.description: Police in New Zealand have found the body of a British woman who disappeared during a hiking trip earlier this week.

item.title: How changing aircraft altitude could cut flight's climate impact in half
item.description: Greener fuels, electric engines and more efficient aircraft are all being touted as ways to reduce the environmental harm of flying, but a new study suggests one simple move could help existing flights drastically cut their impact.

item.title: Woman gives birth on busy highway
item.description: A new mother has thanked emergency services for their help as she gave birth to a baby in a car on the side of a busy highway.

item.title: A look at the Bloomberg-Trump height spat
item.description: Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg jabs President Donald Trump with a new way to measure height. Jeanne Moos reports the height war has reached new heights.

item.title: Storm Dennis will be a menace for the UK
item.description: One week after Storm Ciara lashed the United Kingdom with heavy rain and extreme wind gusts, another storm is knocking at the door.

item.title: Love in conflict: A car bomb ruined her life. Or so she thought
item.description: When Nahla al-Nadawi's husband was killed by a car bomb in Baghdad in 2007, she thought she'd never find love again. Then she met Aqeel.

item.title: Joe Biden's struggles extend to Congress as Bloomberg racks up endorsements
item.description: For months, national polls of the Democratic presidential primary showed former Vice President Joe Biden as the most popular candidate. Then he took a self-described "gut punch" in Iowa and left New Hampshire before the primary results were even delivered.

item.title: Jeff Bezos just dropped $165 million on a new mansion
item.description: The world's richest man is on a real estate binge.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to close office at Buckingham Palace
item.description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan are closing their office at Buckingham Palace, leading to some of its 15 employees becoming redundant.

item.title: Massive asteroid will swing by Earth after Valentine's Day
item.description: Not long after Valentine's Day ends, a massive asteroid estimated to be between 1,443 feet and 3,248 feet long will pass by Earth around 6:05 a.m. ET on Saturday. Based on the size range, it could be anywhere between the size of a suspension bridge to taller than a skyscraper.

item.title: Angry commuters disapprove of motorbike ban
item.description: Motorcycle hailing companies are pivoting towards alternative forms of transport following the ban on commercial motorcycles and tricycles in major parts of Lagos, Nigeria's commercial nerve center.

item.title: Usain Bolt says he considered coming out of retirement
item.description: Usain Bolt's glittering career may have ended on a disappointing note as he pulled up with a hamstring injury in the last 50 meters of the 4x100m at the 2017 world championships, but that may not have been the Jamaican sprint star's final act on the track.

item.title: Flights to Lagos divert to Ghana, leaving passengers stranded
item.description: All international flights bound for Lagos, Nigeria, have been diverted to Ghana following poor weather conditions and complications from new equipment installation.

item.title: New Hampshire man charged with slapping 15-year-old Trump supporter outside polling station
item.description: A New Hampshire man was arrested Thursday afternoon and is facing charges after he allegedly slapped a 15-year-old supporter of President Donald Trump outside a polling place during Tuesday's primary, according to police.

item.title: A 5-year-old's quick thinking saved his sister from a house fire
item.description: A 5-year-old Georgia boy awoke to flames in the bedroom. But he didn't panic, and his actions helped save his entire family.

item.title: See car get airborne after driving through a roundabout
item.description: Long Beach Police arrested a 27-year-old woman for a misdemeanor DUI after she allegedly drove her car through a roundabout and went airborne.

item.title: Woman reunited with mixtape 20 years after she lost it
item.description: A woman has been reunited with a mixtape cassette she lost on holiday, after it washed up on a Spanish beach more than 20 years later.

item.title: Polar bears are getting thinner and having fewer cubs. Melting sea ice is to blame
item.description: The impact of the climate crisis is becoming more and more obvious to humans and their animal neighbors. But among all species, polar bears might be some of the hardest hit.

item.title: 'Parks and Recreation' tweets Galentine's Day picture
item.description: The official "Parks and Recreation" account tweeted a picture of Amy Poehler and her castmates reuniting to celebrate Galentine's Day.

item.title: Behind-the-scenes footage of Meghan's Vogue guest editorship
item.description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex has released a "never before seen video" detailing how she guest-edited the September issue of British Vogue, which shows the duchess and Vogue editor Edward Enninful don glittery party hats.

item.title: This couple has been married for over 80 years
item.description: John and Charlotte Henderson from Austin, Texas, were recently named the world's oldest living couple and just celebrated their 80th wedding anniversary.

item.title: Are you in love or just high on chemicals in your brain?
item.description: We call it "falling in love," as if we have no control over how we topple into that dreamy state of emotional bliss.

item.title: Zlatan vs. Ronaldo: Who wins?
'Stranger Things 4': Hopper returns
item.description: We can't spoil something Netflix already spoiled can we?

item.title: Pele says he's 'not afraid' as he dismisses his son's depression claims
item.description: Soccer legend Pele has played down fears over his mental health after the Brazilian's son suggested he had become depressed due to his inability to walk unaided.

item.title: Dog was VERY happy to reunite with astronaut owner
item.description: After 328 days in space, NASA astronaut Christina Koch received an adorable greeting from her four-legged pet.

item.title: Miley Cyrus closes New York Fashion Week
item.description: It's no secret that the buzz surrounding New York Fashion Week has slowed to a flutter, with America's most experimental designers like Virgil Abloh and Heron Preston ditching the gritty Big Apple in favor of the more pomp displays in Paris and Milan.

item.title: Valentine's Day's dark and twisted origin story
item.description: Well, it's Valentine's Day. Did you bring enough sweethearts for everyone in class?

item.title: China admits six hospital staff have died while hundreds more health workers have caught coronavirus
item.description: Ning Zhu, a nurse in Wuhan, the central Chinese city at the heart of a deadly coronavirus outbreak, is restless.

item.title: US 'can't assess China's coronavirus data'
Europe's stagnant economy vulnerable to shock from China
item.description: Recession fears are stalking Europe again after Germany's economy flatlined at the end of 2019. The coronavirus now threatens to slam exports to China.

item.title: Global death toll reaches 1,383; China purges officials in Hubei
item.description: The number of novel coronavirus cases has risen to more than 64,000 worldwide, after China reported another major increase at the epicenter of the outbreak following a change in how authorities there diagnose cases.

item.title: Expert: We've seen some 'egregious' misstatements of data
item.description: Laurie Garrett, an expert on pandemics and author of "Ebola: Story of an Outbreak," spoke to CNN's Bianca Nobilo about what she thinks is behind the spike in novel coronavirus cases in China.

item.title: No contingency plans in place for Tokyo Olympics
item.description: The Tokyo 2020 Olympics remain "on track" despite the novel coronavirus outbreak in Asia, a top official said Friday.

item.title: China's coronavirus numbers highlight the challenges of an evolving epidemic
item.description: When China reported a drop in the number of new cases of the deadly coronavirus earlier this week, hopes were raised that the outbreak might be slowing down.

item.title: Barr privately ordered reexamination of Michael Flynn's case, US officials say
item.description: Barr's stunning Trump rebuke sparks debate over motives Trump and Bloomberg in Twitter spat
